Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

Celtics fans should stop
crying about the officials

Fans will say the five technicals were a big part of the Celtics’ Game 1 loss to the Heat, but the truth is, they were simply overwhelmed.

Health cost issue divides ex-allies

The state's largest business groups, which played a key role in the 2006 Mass. health care law, are now divided over how to slow the growth of health costs.

Defense lawyer faces case of his career

Federal prosecutors accuse Robert George of conspiring to help a former client launder drug money, and of restructuring bank deposits in violation of tax laws.

Baseball diplomacy

Can baseball be the key to warmer relations between the island nation of Taiwan and mainland China?

For this comic, US history book no joke

Mike Donovan, 57, a stand-up comedian, Southie guy, history madman, is ready to publish his book, a tome of 1.6 million words that took three decades to finish.

Brisk business for Cape over weekend

On a sun-splashed holiday weekend, New Englanders flocked to coastal towns in droves, buoying hotel and shop owners with hopes of a resurgent summer.
